chart_description: This chart displays the rate of input/output operations (I/O) for database tables in bytes per second. It helps to monitor and troubleshoot the I/O usage and performance of the PostgreSQL database server.

dimension_descriptions.disk: This dimension represents the storage device where the table data is being read from or written to. It helps to identify any disk-related performance issues that might affect the I/O rate.
dimension_descriptions.memory: This dimension represents the amount of memory used by the PostgreSQL server for caching data. It helps to understand how the memory usage affects the I/O rate and whether the cache is effective or not.
